channel.title: skyrim configuration tool
channel.description:
Hello all, currently I'm writing a tool to configure Skyrim more easily, so you don't have to edit the *.ini files. At the moment I'm planning the GUI. So... what options do you wish?
[b]DOWNLOAD[/b][/SIZE]
[url='https://www.playblackstudios.net/groups/skyrim-configuration-tool']Tool page[/url]
version 1.2d: [url='https://www.skyrimnexus.com/downloads/file.php?id=814']Download[/url]
[b]Screenshots[/b][/SIZE]
[img]https://www.playblackstudios.net/media/126/download/prevs.jpg[/img] [img]https://www.playblackstudios.net/media/125/download/1%2B3combo.jpg[/img] [img]https://www.playblackstudios.net/media/127/download/3.jpg[/img]

item.dc:creator: pfannkuchen_gesicht
item.description:
spliskn:

No, it is not due to FOV. It doesn’t matter if it is set to 50 or 100 or anything in between. 2560x1600 does not work with this config tool.

unfortunately the FOV is saved in your save files, I hoped bethesda would fix that with the patch.

item.title: skyrim configuration tool
item.dc:creator: spliskn
item.description:
Hi there,

When using this excellent tool, and using my native resolution of 2560x1600, the in-game resolution gets screwed up. It looks as if you have zoomed in a great deal and stretched the visuals.

It works in all other resolutions that come pre-defined in the Config Editor.

Of course I tried using the “custom resolution” and added 2560x1600. I also tested using it with the three different options in the drop down, like 16:9 and 16:10 and then added custom resolution which in my case is 2560x1600. In-game visuals look “zoomed in” and streched.

Can someone help?

Can you look into that?

Read full topic

item.title: skyrim configuration tool
item.dc:creator: Tei
item.description:
For some reason Skyrim won’t recognize my system’s audio settings. Actually, nothing does. Even if i set my settings to “headphones”, i still have surround sound issues with games. The only exceptions are source games; Half-Life and Portal games all have a headphone option that fixes it. Also, there was a custom ini tweaker for Oblivion i used that had key mapping and headphone settings in it. i know it’s a new game engine, but Beth always keep the same console commands and similar functions in every game so i thought it might be the same in Skyrim.

-Kawai Tei-

Read full topic

item.title: skyrim configuration tool
item.dc:creator: pfannkuchen_gesicht
item.description:
Preview in action:

alright, I think I fixed all bugs and can release a first build tomorrow, but the first build won’t include anything regarding models and their LODs, also no sound option and no keyboard mapping settings.(key mapping is hard-coded atm, next patch fixes that)
Sorry for that, but as mentioned before I have to figure out how exactly the variables change the visuals in-game and how they change the sound.
I can tell you the options available in the next build:
-Sound:
–Volumes
couldn’t find more vars there yet, maybe you found one or two?
-Models:
–LOD Distances, to control how detailed models are in the distance.
–toggling VS30 Grass shader and grass fade distances
–toggling animated trees + how many of them are rendered
-Shadows:
–shadow mapping bias scale
–Shadow,light,specular LOD/fade distances

EDIT:
What do you think about the logo?
(open in new tab with white background)

could need some help there.

Read full topic
